textContent:
Now that actually letting go is real. The death is present. The actual loss is being felt. It hurts so fucking bad. And it can be ended if I turn back towards her. Towards a marriage that stays a marriage. One that has worked through the gauntlet of the hardest confrontations of the self. And yet survived. 

To remain in my relationship is to establish boundaries and hold and honor those boundaries with someone who gets me better than anyone ever has. To let go of what that relationship could be because I have already made a commitment to my wife, my son's, my family, my community. I made a commitment to love myself and to love my wife no matter what. Even when it isn't easy. And at the end of the day, I do love my wife. Ive felt like I haven't loved myself. And that loving myself has been at odds with loving her. 

I suck at boundaries. And boundaries are needed. Yet I need help and support in keeping them. 

I suck at time management and instead of feeling like it's a personal slight, I need it to be held as a flaw. 

I suck at directing my focus. It goes outwards, not inwards. And it is broad and widening not narrowing. And yet in my focus is my wife and her state. I am caring for and reading her but I don't want it to feel like unless it's all on her she's not worthy. I need it to be held as part of me. 

I suck at planning events and dates. I am constantly living right in front of me. I don't spend a lot of time thinking about what might happen or how to deal with it. So I like to be spontaneous and make spur of the moment decisions. I don't want this to feel like she's unloved if I don't make a date

But I'm really good at caring. I care deeply to my bones. I love wholly and fully and with a fire and an intensity. I wish this was felt and seen more.

So I can keep going in my marriage and my commitment. I will need to exit the relationship with this person who gets me better than anyone ever has, knows how to support me, and loves my flaws. I can't work with that attraction being so in my face.
